intro: Bostrychanthera deflexa, commonly known as the flexible bristly bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, bristly fruits that contain seeds. Bostrychanthera deflexa is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
